comment.text:
Are you a snob? Do you stick your pinky out when you hold your glass? If so do not come here. Highland tap is an Atlanta institution. It has a below 4 score on Yelp yet on every nite you go the place is slammed. Why? It's an outdated as hell restaurant, a time capsule into the 90s. I always tell my friends it is impossible to have a bad time at Highland Tap.

Went on a Man Date and we both had the time of our lives. One got the Rib Eye, the other got the prime rib. We cut it in half and shared. I've been coming here for 15 years and first shot at the prime rib. Y'all, it's the best I've ever had. We sat at the bar, and the bar tender asked us if we have ever been. I told her Highland Tap is my happy place. I got my dirty martini with Blue cheese stuffed olives and smiled away. 

Bottom line, food snobs stay away. This is a locals spot, who absolutely adore this place.

photos.caption: New York Strip, mushrooms, and Dirty Martini, Vodka, Blue Cheese Stuffed olives.
Dirty Martini, Vodka, Blue Cheese stuffed olives. Comes with a chilled sidecar. A drink you have to get at the tap.
Blue Cheese Olive Dirty Vodka Martini

comment.text:
Came here on a whim after our original plan fell though. Honestly, we had a great tome. I ahd no idea this was here. It's underground which is cool. You'll be surrounded by stacked stone walls. The bar area isn't exacty as cute as the dining room but that didn't matter to us. We ended up in a dining room with lights and huge stone fireplace. Very cozy. 

Food was good. we split the artichoke dip which  was a decent size for an app. My husband got a burger and onion rings. Burger was good. He finished it but was STUFFED. Counld't finish his onion rings but I tired them and they were very good. Thick cut - not super skinny.  I got the Checken sandwhich fried, I had them add pimento cheese (no added cost) and it was very good. Highly reccomend. It was humongous. Like the bun was half the size of the chunk of chicken and I will say I would have liked more pimento cheese but I would absolutely order again. I got my go to French 75, it was good, but very lemony. I had them add some st. germain to my secind one and it was better for me (In like sweet/floral)

For desert we wanted the bread pudding but it sold out before we could order desert (so if you want that say it up front) so we split a slice of red velvet which was very moist. Not too much icing, but not outstanding. 

Server was very friendly and attentive but not overbearing.

We would definitely come back and would bring friends here for an unassuming night.

photos.caption: SPRINGER MOUNTAIN CHICKEN SANDWICH (have them add some pimento cheese)
VARSITY BURGER with onion rings (the rings were SO GOOD)

comment.text:
We had a reservation for Saturday and even though we were a little late the staff were really nice!
We got seated and ordered some drinks to start. To start we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip. The dip was delicious as well with the fresh crispy bread. 
For the main, we got meatloaf, steak sandwich and center cut fillets with different sides. Everything was amazing and we all enjoyed our meals! Our waiter was great and look forward to coming back again!

I've been here a number of times throughout the years.  Very little has changed really.  Same decor for the most part and same great ambience to just duck out of site and cast off the burdens of the day.
Their food is a step beyond standard pub fare - not just burgers and such, they also serve up a good ribeye steak (I got The Tomahawk this past visit) and they make some of the best onion rings in Atlanta!  You can even get oysters Rockefeller.  But I can't end this review without mentioning their great beer and wine menu, and the variety of on tap selections that keep me coming back and happy!

Just adding a photo of my fan favorite. Might seem like a weird thing to order, but Highland Tap's wood-fired meatloaf on a cold night is soul-warming. It's even more perfect when you're nestled up against a stone wall in one of the booths at the bar. You couldn't ask for a cozier dinner.

photos.caption: Highland Tap SAM'S FAMOUS GRILLED MEATLOAF.

comment.text:
Stopped in this low key gem on Tuesday due to long wait next door. It was full and busy but we were sat right away. Friendly service and I love that all the servers help each other out.

I had the salmon and grits and really enjoyed the impactful yet simply stated seasoning. Grits were a bit clumpy as if they were made earlier in the day, but still good. The grapefruit beer on special was AMAZEBALLS!! so refreshing and enjoyable. I'm not even a beer drinker but was intrigued.

I've been coming to this neighborhood gem since the 90s and I must say they still have an amazing martini, vibe, food and customer service. I ran into some old friends after I appeared from the corner and passed the bar. I recommend any of the food. My bestie had a burger, and I had a baked potato and a big salad. Good times and a place to catch up.

I was so excited to finally try Highland Tap after coming and walking by this place all the time! I got a reservation for a Saturday evening and the staff was really nice even though we were a little late which I thought was really nice. 

We got seated and got some beers to drink quickly which was awesome. Our waiter was great! To start, we got the spinach and artichoke dip and the complimentary bread. The dip was delicious and amazing with the little bread crispy and the brown bread was also fresh and warm!

For the main, we got the meatloaf, steak sandwich and the center cut fillets. Everything was delicious and we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals! I thought the steak sandwich was a great deal and all the sides were awesome. This is a great place to bring anyone for dinner and can't wait to come back again.

Pricy for mediocre food. Edible but nothing to get excited about. Bland in my opinion. 

Honorable mention to the Mac and cheese that managed to taste like nothing. 

Service was fine. 

Will not patronize again.

We were recommended to come to this restaurant from a colleague. Made a reservation the day before and got in easily. Love the speakeasy vibes and loved how there is a bar and restaurant section. 

We ordered the pimento cheese dip and spinach and artichoke dip for appetizers. Loved the spinach dip. Came with a lot of little toasts for both dishes but we easily ate it all with the seven of us. I saw some tables with bread but we were not offered any.

For my entree, I got the 10 oz prime rib and garlic spinach. It was perfectly cooked medium rare and had so much flavor. I really enjoyed it and would recommend. It seems like they are known for this dish as many people on other tables were ordering it too.

Drinks were okay - maybe stick to beer and not cocktails.

Service was decent but we were told that we could only split the check six ways and evenly when we were ready to pay. When we made the phone reservation, they told us that they could only split the check evenly for parties over six (we had seven). For some reason, our waitress told us we could only split it SIX ways with seven people. A bit hard as we were all expensing the meal.

Have been here a few times however, will not be back.  There are a lot better places for steak/prime rib than the Highland Tap.
The bar was under staffed hence took forever to get drinks at the table.  
The prime rib was probably the worst.  If you get any toppings (additional cost) or blackened, be prepared for a medium well prime rib.  Had to return the 14oz. prime rib as it was a mangled cut.  Second piece not much better. 
Service was slow and not even a free drink for returned food.

So I came when it was busy but not super busy. The rest of my party wasn't there yet so I have to wait around a little bit and they said that I could go and they wouldn't give away my seat, because they had already seen me. So they're at least going to work with me and they were really nice about it because they saw me there. Super friendly by the way.

When you come in, you got to enter through a door that goes basically to a basement. Which you really don't expect. There's a bar right next to it that I thought it was initially but it was not! You going downstairs and there's a full restaurant and bar down there. Aside from the delay in seating, everything was good. The venue was a little bit dark, but it adds to the Ambiance of it.

All the service was good. You sit out and they give you bread and butter. The menu is about two pages, so it's not overwhelming, but everybody there was willing to explain the menu and answer any questions that you needed to have answered.

I ended up getting the rib eye, which was pretty good. It could have been seasoned a little bit better, but it was still good. It was very tender so I give it points for that. It was a really nice size as well. I had it with the asparagus which came with hollandaise sauce. Definitely worth a try for sure.

I would come back again, for another cut of steak probably. I will say, that the horseradish sauce that came with the prime rib was actually something that went really well with the ribeye. Typically I don't like sauces on my steak, but it needed a little extra, and that was just the perfect thing! So that was a good combination. Yes I would go back again.

My friend and I came here for a late lunch/early dinner. According to my receipt Kory was our server. My friend and I overall had a decent experience, the place is definitely cool and the food was pretty good. I wasn't that big of a fan of their patty melt but the drinks and fries were good and the ribs my friend had were awesome.

The negative side of our experience was that Kory was very much so not convinced my friend and I were of drinking age- lol. I understand we may look young but there is a way to be polite about things. she's 22 and I was there for my 23rd birthday. How many 19 year olds do you know try to go to bars with fakes at 3:30/4pm on a Friday ordering one drink with food- .

When we were looking at the drink menu before giving us a minute to decide Kory said "BY THE WAY we'll have to see your IDs if you order any drinks" ... ok yeah duh? He comes back, we order a drink each, he meticulously looks at our in-state IDs. I thought the fun time was over until he came back with the drinks. When he sees me reaching over to slide mine closer to me he says "oh be careful, it's filled to the top." . As if I can't be trusted to move a glass that's clearly full. My friend and I were respectful to him and gave him a normal tip even though to me- that interaction was offensive as I greatly do not appreciate being treated as a child since I'm a hardworking adult. Maybe he'll learn someday that just because a patron is 20-30 years your junior doesn't mean you can treat them like they're 5 years old. 

Clearly Kory hit a sore spot with me huh? Highland's is probably a pretty good place in general. Without that experience pissing me off this would probably be a 4 or 5 star review so take that as you will.

photos.caption: TAP'S PATTY MELT Fries BOURBON BACON BBQ BABY BACK RIBS MAC N CHEESE

comment.text:
This establishment is to be honest a facade for the management bullying and threatening people into tipping. If you don't tip what they find right, this restaurant will expose you in front of your entire party. I was threatened by some manager named dede. I didn't tip to her liking, even though I received poor service. My server who was a bigger African American gay man was rude, and rushed us. So after he snatched the bifold as if we were keeping him too late;  the manager dede came in and cussed at us for allegedly stealing Martinis, and yanked glassware and a knife out of my boyfriends hand for no reason. He ended up with an injury, then told us how everything we were doing is illegal, and we should be embarrassed of ourselves. Then she brought the bifold back to us as we exited and threatened us to increase the tip, or "there would be problems." 

I WOULD NOT EVER FREQUENT THIS RESTAURANT AGAIN. READ OTHER REVIEWS, THIS IS HAPPENING TO MORE PEOPlE.
Food is always on point.  Great vibes no matter the night of the week.   This is a true gem in VA Highlands
We went for our Christmas dinner for my job and everything was great. Food was amazing and drinks were sooo good. Very nice atmosphere for everyone to enjoy. I will be going back soon.

One of my favorite places in town - Highland Tap has the charm of an old European restaurant/pub. It's downstairs with stone walls and dark interior, a beautifully painted mural on other walls, warm reds and old candle lamps on the tables. The service is always on point. Their cocktails are great... try the dirty martini! They give you a sidecar so it's almost two martinis you get. Monday nights they have a prime rib special that is so good for less than $20. The escargot appetizer is also delicious. Ohhh and the beet with goat cheese salad is amazing - I make it at home now too. Superb! The only thing I don't rave about here are their mashed sweet potatoes, they have too much seasoning. They taste like a spicy pumpkin pie, I enjoy flavor but not THAT much. My husband always orders their greens (he says they are the best he's ever had) - I'm not a greens gal so I'll just take his word for it. We go often, I love the Highlands. We always take our out of town guests here too when they visit cause it is always a big hit.

TIP: There's limited on-street parking in the front, and a steep, narrow staircase to the restaurant below. There's valet parking in the rear, which is at restaurant level. 

Family friends recommended this place and said that the Prime Rib was stellar, so we thought we'd give it a try for Sunday brunch. Overall, I thought our experience was only okay. First, they didn't offer the Prime Rib on the lunch menu, so we really didn't get to test their claim. Service was good, but the food was average. There were some hits, but more misses. Restaurant décor is dark and English tavern like, which I thought was a great atmosphere.

FOOD: Several of us tried Eggs Benedicts, the Traditional Bene ($13), Crab Cake Bene ($22), and the Surf & Turf Bene ($23), all with a side of Grits or Mardi Gras potatoes. The benedicts were all outstanding, as were the Jalapeño Grits, but the Mardi Gras potatoes were a little on the dry side. We also split an Iceberg Wedge Salad ($10), which was good, but nothing special. Same with the Tap's Patty Melt ($14). The Prime Rib Hash & Shirred Eggs ($15) was dry, the meat well done, and not very flavorful. Finally, we had the Tap Egg Platter ($12) which was okay, but the biscuit was dry, and the side of Sausage & Gravy ($8) was bland and watery.

I would like to go back and actually try the Prime Rib, and I think the bar would be a fun place to hang out. At this point, it's hard to say I'd highly recommend Highland Tap, but I'd say it's probably worth giving it a try and judging for yourself.

photos.caption: Limited on-street parking in the front, and a steep, narrow staircase to the restaurant below. There's valet parking in the rear, seen here.
Rear entry available from off-street parking lot with valet service.
Cool painted signage on rear entry.
Dining room décor dark and English tavern like, very cool.
Iceberg Wedge Salad ($10), split for two.
Crab Cake Benedict ($22) with Jalapeño Grits. Outstanding flavors!
Tap's Patty Melt ($14), good, but nothing special.
Prime Rib Hash & Shirred Eggs ($15). Potatoes and meat were dry. Meat was well done, and not very flavorful.

comment.text: Great little place for drinks or food, we only came for drinks. They are one of the first places that gave a "side car" - had to google what that is - basically if the bartender makes extra of your drink, they put it in a small container on the side on ice so you get like 1.5 drinks for the price of 1. Love it. All the cocktails we tried were excellent, I just wish I was in town for the prime rib I keep reading about!
Ambiance+food & service = always a great experience. Certainly a go to spot in the neighborhood.
$47 center cut filet steak. Totally not worth it and overcooked. Service was good though.

photos.caption: $47 center cut filet. Totally not worth it and overcooked.

comment.text: We've been going to Highland Tap for years. It is our go to Restaurant. It just keeps getting better.  Very consistent. Food is always prepared perfectly. wait  staff works in tandem reservations or not. Half price burger nights  Tuesday.  Prime rib Thursday order a drink from the bar and be pleasantly surprised by extra side car drink.

Prime rib medium rare & loaded baked potato  
At this point we are regulars - cozy vibe, great location, good staff & great food

Highland Tap is a really solid spot. They're located in Virginia Highlands in the same building as Fontaine's , La Tavola etc. Valet parking is available in the rear of the building. Don't be thrown off by the retro decor, this place is a gem.

The first time I went, it was with a group and everyone really enjoyed everything. This time, my mom and I were in the area and decided to stop in. There was no wait and we were seated immediately. They have really good drinks! I wanted to get the apricot whiskey sour that I had previously, but they were out of some of the ingredients. We ended up getting a cocktail called "get behind the mule" which is basically a blood orange Moscow mule. It was very refreshing and they don't skimp on the liquor. The calamari was really delicious. My mom got the ribs with collard greens and I had the crab cakes with asparagus and mashed potatoes. While the crab cakes had more breading than I prefer, they were tasty and the vegetables were good. 

Each time I've visited and have been welcomed by the staff and received great customer service.

We enjoyed our meal at the Highland Tap.
It was rocky at first since we struggled to find parking and was 15 mins late for our reservation. However, our server was attentive and fast. The ambience is more casual, which we like. 

We ordered the Oyster Rockefeller, escargot and french onion soup for appetizer. The oysters and escargot were delicious. We cannot say the same about the french onion soup. The first few bites were good but then it started tasting sweet and cinnamonny, tastes we were not familiar with in this soup. It left a weird after taste.

For the main entree, we ordered 32oz prime rib to share with mashed sweet potatoes. The prime rib was the star of the whole meal, especially with the au jus and horse radish. I would order a different side next time as the mashed sweet potation was borderline too soft and too sweet. 

For drink, we had the espresso martini (recommended by our waiter) and it was delicious! 

Would recommend this place and we would return for more prime rib and espresso martini.

photos.caption: 32 oz Prime Rib and Mashed Sweet Potatoes
OYSTERS ROCKEFELLER, 6 EACH ESCARGOT FRENCH ONION SOUP

comment.text:
What a fun place!  We are always looking for different, special, and good.  We were checking out the Virginia Highland area for a place to have a drink.  This place was in a triangle corner, unpretentious looking, and you had to go down!

We did and were we surprised!  Old dark wood paneling, a sunken bar, booths, and a dining area on the side.  We went for a booth.  Great friendly cordial service! Great special drinks! Great bar food!
Great prices!

We had their martini, which is served with a remaining pour, and a regular bourbon and 7.  We had the pretzel and other snacks.  The atmosphere was cheery and dynamic.  The fact that it has no windows escaped us.  Everyone is a regular.  You can tell.  It's one of those places.  A secret neighborhood gem that's an institution.

We definitely want to go back.  I've recommended it to everyone.  I'm surprised many locals have never been!  I almost don't want to say anything!k

As a native Atlantan, I can confidently say that Highland Tap is one of the last real treasures remaining in Atlanta! The food is reliably good (don't sleep on the escargot), and the service is always kind even when they're packed. I love the feel of the inside too, almost like you're in someone's cool uncle's basement. I hope it never changes.

1. The Tuesday Burger Deal is an awesome price for a great steak burger. 2. The bar should make a point to consistently have a lighter Pilsner on tap, an Ultra Light Beer option would be amazing (Don't say "you can get a Michelob Ultra", they suck!, why not a Corona Premier?). 3. Healthier options for sides with the burger, besides fried greasy onion rings, or fried french fries (what about a vegetable salad or vegetable chips)?The staff is awesome & the bathrooms are clean, the ambience is pretty cool too...

Had a reservation for 7 and was seated as soon as we came in. The place has a nice ambiance, classic steak house vibe for sure. I got the ribeye with the spinach and then we shared the oyster Rockefeller and calamari. The calamari and oysters were very sub par, they were lacking flavor. Steak was excellent and cooked perfectly. The spinach on the side was decent but nothing to write home about. Would eat here again but not top of the list.

Excellent prime rib! Tender and cooked perfectly. Great service too! Our salads were good as was the baked potato.
Will be back again and again.

The Steak literally smelled and tasted like actual poop. I wish I was kidding. Service was slow (given it was a Friday). Martinis are fantastic and the vibe is pretty good. Just can't believe the one steak actually made the whole table smell like poop. The other steaks and salmon entree were not great either.

Vibes were good, come if you want to hangout but maybe grab dinner somewhere else. 

(Sorry server you were so sweet)

We celebrated father days there. We are from Chicago and this was very surprisingly good. 
The vibe of the underground place the delicious food, the kind waiter made the whole celebration a successful event. 
We will go back and definitely recommend.

This place is neat. Would be perfect for a date night, has retro vibes and exposed brick/block walls. You have to climb down stairs upon entry through the front door, so be mindful or you might miss it. They had a large beer and cocktail menu, but I came for the french onion soup. I enjoyed it! Had the perfect amount of bread/onion/broth/cheese on top. A friends got the artichoke and spinach dip which was just alright to me, nothing to write home about. My other friends got steaks and they all enjoyed those as well. Parking can be a challenge to find, there's only street parking available or valet lots I believe. I was able to circle the block and find something on the street. Can't wait to come back and try more food when I have a bigger appetite.

I try not to judge a book by its cover but I admit, walking down the stairs into Highland Tap, I didn't know what to expect. The atmosphere is very pub-like...dark, a little dated, customer emphasis on the bar but the food was such a great surprise. 

First, let me start with the drinks...they're strong! For food, we ordered the oysters and spinach artichoke dip. The dip was good, nothing over the top but it was a good dip and the toast rounds they serve with it are perfectly toasted and seasoned. The oysters were cooked really well. I'm a texture person and I don't usually like oysters but these had enough firmness to make it pleasant to eat.

For my entree, I ordered the braised lamb shank. I was happy it was a really good sized shank; I wasn't even able to finish it. Despite the size, the meat was really tender and well-seasoned. The jus was really good but I wish they added a little more mashed potatoes to soak up all that ju. The next day, I woke up and continued to eat the lamb. I'll be back for this lamb for sure!

tuesdays are my favorite days to go because of their burger deals, but all the food is great! the restaurant it's self feels like you've been taken back in time but the food is quality and it's a great place to visit if you're looking for classic american food
The food, drinks and the service were exceptional. I love the atmosphere of the Highland Tap. It has some of the best calamari and fresh cut onions rings. Will be back.

We had an early dinner here before seeing the Christmas lights at ABG. The meal was delicious and our server was efficient and friendly. Big shoutout for the music playlist which was straight from the 70s and awesome.

Great small little restaurant.  You have to go downstairs and to the right to enter the facility.  When you enter there's a small bar in front of you and the actual restaurant is off to the right.  The place is small and cozy.  You wouldn't expect a place like this to have great food.

They have a 36 oz tomahawk ribeye that's bigger than the plate it's served on .  They serve collard greens and was actually pretty good.  The greens had a sweet/ smokey flavor to it (I l like greens that are made with vinegar) which caught me by suprise.

Nice place
Nice food
Recommend this place!

Went for Brunch and they offer a good variety. Nice central location in Virginia Highlands if meeting friends from different sides of town or looking to hang out after. Crowded area but this must be a kept secret as it was not as crowded as surrounding restaurants. I still recommend a reservation. Complimentary parking behind restaurant in lot. Chicken & Waffles, Veggie Omelet, Grilled Veggies and Eggs, and Steak and Eggs are all recommended from our dishes.

photos.caption: Mimosas and Martini drink selections for brunch

comment.text:
Roasted beet salad and The Tap Gin Martini extra dirty with blue cheese olives and great conversation!

What else could you possibly need?!

Christmas Eve dinner with my favorite person was a beautiful experience at this restaurant. It gave me Christmas vibes all along starting from the moment I entered (the decoration is beautiful) 

We ordered their famous slow cooked Prime Rib. It was truly one of the best prime ribs I've ever had. 

The other dish I ordered was the Chicken Marsala- it was delicious on a different level.. hahahaaha....very tender and flavorful. Usually chicken breasts don't cook that well but this was over the top and I'll be definitely going back for it. 

It was snowing a little when we started with the main course and the view from where I was sitting was mesmerizing. I had their Christmas tree and wreath on one side, amazing food in front of me and there was snow on the other side. What else can you ask for on a Christmas Eve? 

There were plenty of street parking available right infront of the restaurant so that made life easy. 

Lastly, my wallet didn't cry when I saw the check because the food turned out to be pretty reasonable.

I loved this restaurant. It's been open since 1989 and has rough hewn rock walls and cool neon lights that really set the tone. Our waiter (and the cook) went above and beyond to accommodate us and were super friendly and knowledgeable. And the food and drinks were both great! The highland skillet really hit the spot after a long day.

So let me start off by saying the service was great! When I arrived, they had just wrapped up brunch, so we sat at the bar and had drinks until they reopened for food. Drinks were tasty, and one of the bartenders was in a really good mood. Upon making it to our table. We got the escargot and the spinach dip as appetizers and then we got the prime rib with the mushrooms and later ordered six oysters. I was not a fan of the food at all. I can tell that it was fresh, but it was just something about it all that was lacking flavor. The escargot was very basic. The escargot crust had no real tasting notes and the  escargot itself just tasted bland like they boiled in water and put it under the puffs. The spinach dip was a good texture, and the baguettes that came with it were nice and crispy, but there was  something missing. The prime rib was a nice texture as well but to me it also didn't have any significant tasting notes, so I was glad that they brought out the sauces with it. Lastly, I had six oysters, as they were the special.  Whomever had shucked them. I guess they wasted all of the oyster liquor out of them so they were a little dry and sticking to the shell. I am a Oyster person, so it was not the best experience and for $18 I was not happy. Overall I'm not sure I'd be back, but if I do come back, maybe I'll try a regular steak and see what that taste like.
Tuesday night is half off steak burgers.  Delicous and a bargain.  Also love the dirty martini.

December 2020

I am happy to write this review. 

We parked via valet. Service was quick and bring cash for tips only. 

I dressed UP for this dinner,  but quickly realized that it is a more casual environment,despite being served really good food and wine.  


Our server was attentive.  
Water was always filled. His recommended products were also enjoyed . 

We did baked oysters,  seared fish (trout),  wedge salad.  
All parts were super delicious and I could taste the freshness. 
Ambiance: 5/5
Price: 5/5
Taste: 5/5
Location: 5/5
Value: 5/5

Bottom Line:

Tasty and diverse menu along with the 'Cheers' vibes and atmosphere is a win win here!

This place is always a great option for when you want to feel like a member of the Rat Pack, and I'm not referring to rodents. The atmosphere is from another time. The staff are always bustling when it's busy, personable when the pace is a bit slow. They're one of the few restaurants that know what a Pittsburgh steak means. The cocktails are on point, and the draft beer selection is plentiful. Be sure to check out this hidden gem if you're feeling swanky.

photos.caption: Dirty martini (with chilled extra back) with Bleu cheese olives, and a sazerac.

comment.text: Typically, the food and drinks are amazing so not a bad review. But on a recent visit my service dog prompted someone to ask us to leave. Per ADA it's just not right. I declared my dog as a service animal for seizures(epilepsy) and we were asked to leave because we didn't have "papers". There is no such thing as papers for a service dog and even explaining this we had to leave. Go here for a martini without a dog. Otherwise they don't know the law. Bar Bacoa was awesome and friendly if you are rejected here.

Wanted to try this place out, and I must say it was a good decision. The drinks, the food and the atmosphere was cool. I should have taken a pic of the food. I had the New York Strip with a loaded baked potato

I have been coming to the Tap for a few years now and I have to say that I'm very impressed. First of all, the food is very good. I love the chicken sandwich and the wife and I are come in once a week. I have never experienced better staff at any restaurant. They remember my order, including whether I need a side of blue cheese with my order. I always leave very pleased and would highly recommend this place.
Came in 15 minutes before the kitchen closed. Best. Prime. Rib. Of. My. Life. The joint topped with holla raise and crawfish was insaaaane. They made it with pride omg. Must return!
